intro: Corymbium laxum subsp. laxum, commonly known as the slender corymbium, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The species is characterized by its slender, often branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and usually have a slightly rough texture. This plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
